fields.name: Aces of Luftwaffe
fields.description: Aces of the Luftwaffe depicts World War II as Dynasty Warriors of the sky. German air forces mass together to face down their puny British opposition with incalculable, implausible numbers. The fuel expenses alone would bankrupt Germany, let alone the ammunition.

fields.name: Asteroids I
fields.description: Asteroids is a space-themed multidirectional shooter arcade video game designed by Lyle Rains and Ed Logg released in November 1979 by Atari, Inc.[4] The player controls a single spaceship in an asteroid field which is periodically traversed by flying saucers. The object of the game is to shoot and destroy the asteroids and saucers, while not colliding with either, or being hit by the saucers' counter-fire. The game becomes harder as the number of asteroids increases.

fields.name: Atari: Retro Joystick
fields.description:
Features:
1. An advanced joystick controller with an operating button and a four-way joystick.
2. Adopt ergonomic design, comfortable grip.
3. Suitable for all Atari 2600 systems, also compatible with Atari 7800 console (all games of Atari 7800 are not supported).
4. Made of high quality environmentally friendly materials, wear resistant.
5. It enjoys a long service life.

Specification:
Material: ABS
Model: Atari 7800
Interface Type: 9pin
Product weight: about 200g/7.05oz
Size: about 9.6*8.5*11.6cm/3.78*3.35*4.57in

Package List:
1 * Joystick

fields.name: Toshinden: Battle Arena
fields.description: Battle Arena Toshinden (Toshinden in Japan) is a fighting game for the PC DOS and PlayStation. It was one of the first fighting games to boast polygonal characters in a 3D battle arena, rather than the traditional side-to-side fighting space that had been popular since Street Fighter II.

fields.name: Bubble Blaster
fields.description: Bubble Blast is a bubble shooter game where you have to pop the bubbles and try to completely clear the field. The further you go, the more skill and ability to think tactically you need!

fields.name: Plushies: Darth Vader
fields.description:
Fans of Star Wars can join the dark side with the Darth Vader Voice Manipulator Plush.
Approximately 11-inches tall, this soft doll includes a light-up lightsaber and voice-changing feature.
Press the button on his hand to activate the lightsaber and to use the voice changer to manipulate your voice!
Film accurate details on the character figure celebrate the Sith Lord's appearance in Obi-Wan Kenobi on Disney+.
The collectible toy makes a great gift for Star Wars fans!

fields.name: Donkey Kong Arcade Machine
fields.description:
Before Mario became a household name, he was Mr. Video, and he was the protagonist in the Donkey Kong classic arcade game. Mr. Video, Lady, Donkey Kong — bring the whole gang in the Donkey Kong Arcade Machine for your next corporate sales meeting, trade show booth, holiday party, ‘80s themed event, or another setting to bring a barrel of fun to the occasion!

Original Donkey Kong Arcade Machine Features & Specs
Classic arcade game that launched household-name Mario series
Recognizable game and characters draw crowds, build buzz, and encourage interaction
Multiple levels with different setups for engaging, consistently exciting gameplay
Retro game perfect for ‘80s themed events
Minimal surface area makes Donkey Kong ideal for trade show booths
Also great for holiday parties, ‘80s themed events, activations, sales meetings, and more
DIMENSIONS: 36″ L x 26″ W x 84″ H
ELECTRICITY: 120V, 3A
WEIGHT: 382 lbs
Pairs well with other classic arcade games as well as sports games and trade show traffic builders!

fields.name: Final Fantasy IV
fields.description: In Final Fantasy IV, the player controls a large cast of characters and completes quests to advance the story. Characters move and interact with people and objects on a field map, which may represent a variety of settings, such as towers, caves, and forests. Travel between areas occurs on the overworld. The player can use towns to replenish strength, buy equipment, and discover clues about their next destination.[16] Conversely, the player fights monsters at random intervals on the overworld and in dungeons. In battle, the player has the option to fight, use magic or an item, retreat, change character positions, parry, or pause. Certain characters have special abilities.[16] The game was the first in the series to allow the player to control up to five characters in their party; previous games had limited the party to four.[17]

fields.description: Popular alternative to CAPCOM's street fighter series. A must for fans of the genre.

fields.name: Pinball
fields.description: Pinball (JP) is a game for the NES that was made by Nintendo. Like the name suggests, the game is a pinball game, that is featured on a big board. There is also a minor cameo featuring Mario and Pauline. The game was later released on the E-Reader, and on the game Animal Crossing as an extra.

fields.description: GAME DESCRIPTION Pongo is a 3D action platformer that combines pogo stick jumps with strategic FPS combat. Grab your Pongo, a tool usable as either a pogo stick or a gun, to obliterate enemies and traverse the vast islands of Flubber.

fields.name: Super Star Wars
fields.description: Most of the stages consist of run and gun and platforming gameplay, with several different upgrades available to the standard blaster weapon. Luke can also wield a lightsaber after acquiring it from Obi-Wan Kenobi. The end of the game has players reenacting Luke's Death Star trench run to destroy the Death Star, with Darth Vader confronting the player in his TIE Advanced x1.
